full_text: Disease: Acne. Also known as: Pimples. Category: Global | Sub-category: Dermatology. Explanation: A common skin condition that causes pimples, especially on the face, neck, and back.. Precautions: bath twice, avoid too many products, avoid fatty spicy food, drink plenty of water

Disease: Acute Respiratory Infection (ARI). Also known as: ARI. Category: Global | Sub-category: Infectious Disease. Explanation: Infection of the respiratory tract which can cause cough, cold, and difficulty in breathing.

Disease: AIDS (Acquired Immunodeficiency Syndrome). Also known as: AIDS. Category: Global | Sub-category: Infectious Disease. Explanation: A serious condition caused by the HIV virus that damages the body's immune system, making it hard to fight off infections.

Disease: Allergy. Category: Global | Sub-category: Immunology. Explanation: When the body's immune system reacts to something harmless like pollen or certain foods, causing symptoms like sneezing, itching, or a rash.. Precautions: use ice to compress itching, cover area with bandage, apply calamine
Disease: Alzheimer's Disease. Category: Global | Sub-category: Neurology. Explanation: A brain disease that slowly destroys memory and thinking skills.

Disease: Anemia. Also known as: Low blood count. Category: Global | Sub-category: Hematology. Explanation: A condition where you don't have enough healthy red blood cells to carry oxygen around your body, often making you feel tired and weak.. Symptoms: Fatigue, weakness, pale skin, shortness of breath. Treatments: Iron supplementation, dietary changes (iron-rich foods), managing underlying causes (such as treating iron deficiency or vitamin B12 deficiency), prenatal vitamins
Disease: Angina. Also known as: Chest pain. Category: Global | Sub-category: Cardiology. Explanation: Chest pain that happens when your heart muscle doesn't get enough blood.

Disease: Appendicitis. Category: Global | Sub-category: Gastroenterology. Explanation: Swelling and pain of the appendix, a small pouch attached to the large intestine, which usually requires surgery to remove.

Disease: Arthritis. Also known as: Joint pain. Category: Global | Sub-category: Rheumatology. Explanation: Swelling and tenderness of one or more of your joints, causing pain and stiffness.. Symptoms: Joint pain, stiffness, swelling. Treatments: Medications, physical therapy, surgery (in severe cases). Precautions: use hot and cold therapy, exercise, massage, try acupuncture

Disease: Asthma. Category: Global | Sub-category: Pulmonology. Explanation: A lung disease that makes it hard to breathe, often causing wheezing and coughing.. Symptoms: Recurrent episodes of wheezing, shortness of breath, chest tightness, coughing, especially at night or in response to triggers such as allergens or exercise. Treatments: Long-term control medications (such as inhaled corticosteroids, long-acting beta-agonists), quick-relief medications (such as short-acting beta-agonists), avoidance of triggers (such as allergens, smoke), regular monitoring of symptoms and lung function, development of an asthma action plan, proper inhaler technique, regular follow-up with a healthcare provider, emergency medications (such as oral corticosteroids) as needed

Disease: Atherosclerosis. Also known as: Hardening of the arteries. Category: Global | Sub-category: Cardiology. Explanation: The hardening and narrowing of your arteries caused by a buildup of plaque, which can lead to heart attacks and strokes.
Disease: Athlete's Foot. Also known as: Tinea pedis. Category: Global | Sub-category: Dermatology. Explanation: A fungal infection that usually begins between the toes, causing an itchy, scaly rash.
Disease: Autism Spectrum Disorder (ASD). Also known as: Autism. Category: Global | Sub-category: Neurology. Explanation: A developmental disorder that affects communication and behavior.
Disease: Autoimmune Disease. Category: Global | Sub-category: Immunology. Explanation: A condition where your body's immune system mistakenly attacks your own healthy cells.

Disease: Bacterial Vaginosis. Also known as: BV. Category: Global | Sub-category: Gynecology. Explanation: A type of vaginal inflammation caused by the overgrowth of bacteria naturally found in the vagina.
Disease: Bell's Palsy. Category: Global | Sub-category: Neurology. Explanation: A condition that causes a temporary weakness or paralysis of the muscles on one side of the face.

Disease: Benign Prostatic Hyperplasia (BPH). Also known as: Enlarged prostate. Category: Global | Sub-category: Urology. Explanation: An age-associated prostate gland enlargement that can cause urination difficulty.

Disease: Bipolar Disorder. Also known as: Manic depression. Category: Global | Sub-category: Psychiatry. Explanation: A mental health condition that causes extreme mood swings that include emotional highs (mania or hypomania) and lows (depression).. Symptoms: Mood swings, manic episodes, depressive episodes. Treatments: Medications (mood stabilizers, antipsychotics), therapy

Disease: Bronchitis. Category: Global | Sub-category: Pulmonology. Explanation: Inflammation of the lining of your bronchial tubes, which carry air to and from your lungs, often causing coughing and shortness of breath.. Symptoms: Persistent cough with yellow or green mucus, chest congestion, fatigue. Treatments: Rest, fluids, over-the-counter cough suppressants, inhalers (if prescribed), treating underlying cause

Disease: Brucellosis. Also known as: Malta fever. Category: India-specific | Sub-category: Infectious Disease. Explanation: A bacterial infection that spreads from animals to people, often through unpasteurized dairy products.
Disease: Bubonic Plague. Also known as: Plague. Category: Global | Sub-category: Infectious Disease. Explanation: A serious bacterial infection that's transmitted by fleas.
Disease: Candidiasis. Also known as: Thrush. Category: Global | Sub-category: Infectious Disease. Explanation: A fungal infection caused by a yeast (a type of fungus) called Candida.
Disease: Cataract. Also known as: Motiyabind. Category: Global | Sub-category: Ophthalmology. Explanation: A clouding of the normally clear lens of your eye, which can make it harder to see.

Disease: Celiac Disease. Also known as: Gluten intolerance. Category: Global | Sub-category: Gastroenterology. Explanation: An immune reaction to eating gluten, a protein found in wheat, barley, and rye.

Disease: Cellulitis. Category: Global | Sub-category: Dermatology. Explanation: A common and sometimes serious bacterial skin infection that causes redness, swelling, and pain in the infected area.. Symptoms: Redness, Pain, tenderness, Swelling, Skin changes, Lymph node enlargement. Treatments: Antibiotics, Warm compresses, immobilization, rest, Pain management
Disease: Cerebral Palsy. Also known as: CP. Category: Global | Sub-category: Neurology. Explanation: A group of disorders that affect a personâ€™s ability to move and maintain balance and posture.

Disease: Chagas Disease. Also known as: American trypanosomiasis. Category: Global | Sub-category: Infectious Disease. Explanation: An inflammatory, infectious disease caused by a parasite found in the feces of the triatomine (kissing) bug.. Symptoms: Fever, fatigue, body aches, heart and digestive problems. Treatments: Antiparasitic medications, medications to manage symptoms, supportive care
Disease: Chikungunya. Category: India-specific | Sub-category: Infectious Disease. Explanation: A viral infection transmitted to humans by infected mosquitoes, causing fever and severe joint pain.
Disease: Chlamydia. Category: Global | Sub-category: Infectious Disease. Explanation: A common sexually transmitted infection (STI) that can infect both men and women.

Disease: Cholera. Also known as: Haiza. Category: India-specific | Sub-category: Infectious Disease. Explanation: A bacterial disease usually spread through contaminated water, causing severe diarrhea and dehydration.

Disease: Chronic Kidney Disease (CKD). Also known as: Kidney failure. Category: Global | Sub-category: Nephrology. Explanation: A condition where the kidneys are damaged and cannot filter blood as well as they should.

Disease: Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease (COPD). Also known as: COPD. Category: Global | Sub-category: Pulmonology. Explanation: A chronic inflammatory lung disease that causes obstructed airflow from the lungs.

Disease: Cirrhosis. Category: Global | Sub-category: Gastroenterology. Explanation: Late-stage scarring (fibrosis) of the liver caused by various liver diseases and conditions, such as hepatitis and chronic alcoholism.. Symptoms: Fatigue, jaundice, abdominal swelling (ascites), easy bruising and bleeding, confusion, loss of appetite, weight loss. Treatments: Treatment aims to manage symptoms, slow down disease progression, and address underlying causes. It may include: lifestyle modifications (e.g., avoiding alcohol, maintaining a healthy diet), medication (e.g., diuretics, lactulose, antiviral drugs), procedures (e.g., paracentesis, transjugular intrahepatic portosystemic shunt), liver transplantation (in severe cases)
Disease: Colorectal Cancer. Also known as: Bowel cancer. Category: Global | Sub-category: Oncology. Explanation: A cancer that starts in the colon or the rectum.

Disease: Congestive Heart Failure. Also known as: Heart failure. Category: Global | Sub-category: Cardiology. Explanation: A chronic condition in which the heart doesn't pump blood as well as it should.
Disease: Conjunctivitis. Also known as: Pink eye. Category: Global | Sub-category: Ophthalmology. Explanation: Inflammation or infection of the outer membrane of the eyeball and the inner eyelid.

Disease: Coronary Artery Disease (CAD). Also known as: Heart disease. Category: Global | Sub-category: Cardiology. Explanation: A condition where the major blood vessels that supply the heart with blood, oxygen, and nutrients (coronary arteries) become damaged or diseased.

Disease: COVID-19. Also known as: Coronavirus. Category: Global | Sub-category: Infectious Disease. Explanation: An infectious disease caused by the SARS-CoV-2 virus, which can cause respiratory illness.. Symptoms: Fever, dry, cough. Treatments: Home care is usually enough, Fever and pain can be managed with paracetamol (acetaminophen), Fever and pain can be managed with paracetamol (acetaminophen), Monitor symptoms closely.
Disease: Crohn's Disease. Category: Global | Sub-category: Gastroenterology. Explanation: A type of inflammatory bowel disease (IBD) that causes inflammation of your digestive tract.

Disease: Cystic Fibrosis. Category: Global | Sub-category: Genetics. Explanation: A hereditary disease that affects the lungs and digestive system.. Symptoms: Persistent cough with thick mucus, recurrent lung infections, poor growth or weight gain, salty-tasting skin. Treatments: Medications (mucus-thinning drugs, bronchodilators), chest physical therapy, enzyme supplements, lung transplant (in severe cases)
Disease: Dementia. Category: Global | Sub-category: Neurology. Explanation: A general term for a decline in mental ability severe enough to interfere with daily life.

Disease: Dengue Fever. Also known as: Breakbone fever. Category: India-specific | Sub-category: Infectious Disease. Explanation: A mosquito-borne viral infection causing a severe flu-like illness and, sometimes, a potentially lethal complication called severe dengue.. Symptoms: High fever, severe headache, joint and muscle pain, rash, nausea or vomiting, bleeding tendencies. Treatments: Supportive care (hydration, pain relievers, rest), monitoring, medical attention for severe cases (fluid replacement, blood transfusion, hospitalization)
Disease: Depression. Category: Global | Sub-category: Psychiatry. Explanation: A mood disorder causing a persistent feeling of sadness and loss of interest.

Disease: Diabetes Mellitus. Also known as: Sugar. Category: Global | Sub-category: Endocrinology. Explanation: A disease in which your body either doesn't make enough insulin or can't effectively use the insulin it does make, leading to high blood sugar levels.
Disease: Diarrhea. Also known as: Dast. Category: Global | Sub-category: Gastroenterology. Explanation: Loose, watery stools three or more times in a day.
Disease: Diphtheria. Category: Global | Sub-category: Infectious Disease. Explanation: A serious bacterial infection that can lead to difficulty breathing, heart problems, and nerve damage.
Disease: Down Syndrome. Category: Global | Sub-category: Genetics. Explanation: A genetic condition that causes developmental and intellectual delays.

Disease: Dracunculiasis (Guinea-Worm Disease). Also known as: Guinea worm. Category: India-specific | Sub-category: Infectious Disease. Explanation: A parasitic infection caused by the Guinea worm, which is contracted by drinking water contaminated with the parasite's larvae.
Disease: Dysentery. Category: Global | Sub-category: Gastroenterology. Explanation: An infection of the intestines that causes bloody diarrhea.

Disease: E. coli Infection. Category: Global | Sub-category: Infectious Disease. Explanation: Infection with a type of bacteria called Escherichia coli, which can cause severe stomach cramps, diarrhea, and vomiting.

Disease: Ebola Virus Disease. Also known as: Ebola. Category: Global | Sub-category: Infectious Disease. Explanation: A rare but deadly virus that causes fever, body aches, and diarrhea, and in some cases, bleeding inside and outside the body.

Disease: Eczema. Also known as: Atopic dermatitis. Category: Global | Sub-category: Dermatology. Explanation: A condition that makes your skin red and itchy.. Symptoms: Itchy, red, inflamed skin, rash. Treatments: Emollients (moisturizers), topical corticosteroids or immunomodulators, avoiding triggers
Disease: Edema. Also known as: Swelling. Category: Global | Sub-category: General Medicine. Explanation: Swelling caused by excess fluid trapped in your body's tissues.

Disease: Elephantiasis. Also known as: Filaria, Hathipaon. Category: India-specific | Sub-category: Infectious Disease. Explanation: A condition characterized by gross enlargement of an area of the body, especially the limbs, caused by obstruction of the lymphatic system.

Disease: Endometriosis. Category: Global | Sub-category: Gynecology. Explanation: A painful disorder in which tissue similar to the tissue that normally lines the inside of your uterus â€” the endometrium â€” grows outside your uterus.. Symptoms: Pelvic pain (during menstruation, intercourse, or bowel movements), heavy menstrual bleeding, infertility. Treatments: Pain management (such as nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drugs [NSAIDs], hormonal contraceptives, or progestins), hormone therapy (such as gonadotropin-releasing hormone [GnRH] agonists or oral contraceptives), surgical interventions (such as laparoscopic excision or hysterectomy), fertility treatments (if pregnancy is desired), lifestyle modifications (such as regular exercise, stress management), complementary therapies (such as acupuncture or dietary changes)

Disease: Epilepsy. Also known as: Seizure disorder, Mirgi. Category: Global | Sub-category: Neurology. Explanation: A neurological disorder in which brain activity becomes abnormal, causing seizures or periods of unusual behavior, sensations, and sometimes loss of awareness.
Disease: Fibroids. Category: Global | Sub-category: Gynecology. Explanation: Noncancerous growths of the uterus that often appear during childbearing years.

Disease: Fibromyalgia. Category: Global | Sub-category: Rheumatology. Explanation: A disorder characterized by widespread musculoskeletal pain accompanied by fatigue, sleep, memory and mood issues.. Symptoms: Widespread musculoskeletal pain, fatigue, sleep disturbances. Treatments: Medications (such as pain relievers, antidepressants, anticonvulsants), physical therapy, cognitive-behavioral therapy, stress management techniques, exercise, relaxation techniques, good sleep hygiene

Disease: Filariasis. Category: India-specific | Sub-category: Infectious Disease. Explanation: A parasitic disease caused by an infection with roundworms of the Filarioidea type, which is spread by blood-feeding black flies and mosquitoes.
Disease: Fluorosis. Category: India-specific | Sub-category: Dental. Explanation: A cosmetic condition that affects the teeth, caused by overexposure to fluoride during the first eight years of life.
Disease: Food Poisoning. Category: Global | Sub-category: Gastroenterology. Explanation: Illness caused by eating contaminated food.
Disease: Gallstones. Category: Global | Sub-category: Gastroenterology. Explanation: Hardened deposits of digestive fluid that can form in your gallbladder.

Disease: Gastroenteritis. Also known as: Stomach flu. Category: Global | Sub-category: Gastroenterology. Explanation: An inflammation of the stomach and intestines, typically resulting from bacterial toxins or viral infection and causing vomiting and diarrhea.. Precautions: rest, try taking small sips of water, ease back into eating, stop eating solid food for while

Disease: Gastroesophageal Reflux Disease (GERD). Also known as: Acid reflux. Category: Global | Sub-category: Gastroenterology. Explanation: A digestive disorder that affects the ring of muscle between your esophagus and your stomach.. Symptoms: Heartburn, acid reflux, chest pain. Treatments: Lifestyle changes, medications (antacids, proton pump inhibitors)
Disease: Genital Herpes. Also known as: Herpes. Category: Global | Sub-category: Infectious Disease. Explanation: A common sexually transmitted infection marked by genital pain and sores.
Disease: Giardiasis. Category: Global | Sub-category: Infectious Disease. Explanation: An intestinal infection caused by a giardia parasite, which is spread through contaminated food or water.

Disease: Glaucoma. Also known as: Kala motia. Category: Global | Sub-category: Ophthalmology. Explanation: A group of eye conditions that damage the optic nerve, the health of which is vital for good vision.

Disease: Goiter. Also known as: Ghengha. Category: Global | Sub-category: Endocrinology. Explanation: An abnormal enlargement of your thyroid gland.. Symptoms: Enlarged thyroid gland in the neck, swelling or visible protrusion, difficulty swallowing or breathing. Treatments: Treatment depends on the underlying cause (medication, radioactive iodine therapy, surgery)

Disease: Gonorrhea. Category: Global | Sub-category: Infectious Disease. Explanation: A sexually transmitted bacterial infection that, if untreated, may cause infertility.. Symptoms: Painful urination, abnormal discharge from the genitals, pelvic pain. Treatments: Antibiotics (dual therapy with ceftriaxone and azithromycin), safe sexual practices, partner notification

Disease: Gout. Category: Global | Sub-category: Rheumatology. Explanation: A form of arthritis that causes severe pain, redness, and tenderness in joints.. Symptoms: Intense joint pain, swelling, redness. Treatments: Medications (nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drugs, colchicine), lifestyle changes
Disease: Guillain-BarrÃ© Syndrome. Category: Global | Sub-category: Neurology. Explanation: A rare disorder in which your body's immune system attacks your nerves.

Disease: Haemophilia. Category: Global | Sub-category: Hematology. Explanation: A rare disorder in which your blood doesn't clot normally because it lacks sufficient blood-clotting proteins (clotting factors).

Disease: Hand, Foot, and Mouth Disease. Category: Global | Sub-category: Infectious Disease. Explanation: A mild, contagious viral infection common in young children, characterized by sores in the mouth and a rash on the hands and feet.
Disease: Hay Fever. Also known as: Allergic rhinitis. Category: Global | Sub-category: Immunology. Explanation: An allergic response causing itchy, watery eyes, sneezing, and other similar symptoms.

Disease: Heart Attack. Also known as: Myocardial infarction. Category: Global | Sub-category: Cardiology. Explanation: A blockage of blood flow to the heart muscle.. Precautions: call ambulance, keep calm, chew or swallow asprin

Disease: Heat Stroke. Category: Global | Sub-category: General Medicine. Explanation: A condition caused by your body overheating, usually as a result of prolonged exposure to or physical exertion in high temperatures.
Disease: Hepatitis. Category: Global | Sub-category: Gastroenterology. Explanation: Inflammation of the liver, usually caused by a viral infection.

Disease: Hepatitis A. Category: Global | Sub-category: Infectious Disease. Explanation: A highly contagious liver infection caused by the hepatitis A virus, which is spread through contaminated food or water.. Precautions: medication, wash hands through, avoid fatty spicy food, Consult nearest hospital

Disease: Hepatitis B. Category: Global | Sub-category: Infectious Disease. Explanation: A serious liver infection caused by the hepatitis B virus that's easily preventable by a vaccine.. Precautions: eat healthy, medication, vaccination, consult nearest hospital

Disease: Hepatitis C. Category: Global | Sub-category: Infectious Disease. Explanation: An infection caused by a virus that attacks the liver and leads to inflammation.. Precautions: eat healthy, medication, vaccination, Consult nearest hospital

Disease: Hepatitis E. Category: India-specific | Sub-category: Infectious Disease. Explanation: A liver disease caused by the hepatitis E virus, which is transmitted mainly through contaminated drinking water.. Precautions: stop alcohol consumption, medication, rest, consult doctor

Disease: Herpes Simplex Virus (HSV). Also known as: Herpes. Category: Global | Sub-category: Infectious Disease. Explanation: A virus that causes contagious sores, most often around the mouth or on the genitals.

Disease: High Blood Pressure. Also known as: Hypertension. Category: Global | Sub-category: Cardiology. Explanation: A common condition in which the long-term force of the blood against your artery walls is high enough that it may eventually cause health problems, such as heart disease.

Disease: High Cholesterol. Also known as: Hyperlipidemia. Category: Global | Sub-category: Cardiology. Explanation: A condition where you have too much of a waxy substance called cholesterol in your blood.

Disease: HIV (Human Immunodeficiency Virus). Also known as: HIV. Category: Global | Sub-category: Infectious Disease. Explanation: A virus that attacks the body's immune system, which can lead to AIDS if not treated.
Disease: Hookworm Infection. Category: India-specific | Sub-category: Infectious Disease. Explanation: A parasitic infection of the small intestine caused by hookworms.

Disease: Human Papillomavirus (HPV) Infection. Also known as: HPV. Category: Global | Sub-category: Infectious Disease. Explanation: A viral infection that's passed between people through skin-to-skin contact.
Disease: Huntington's Disease. Category: Global | Sub-category: Neurology. Explanation: An inherited condition in which nerve cells in the brain break down over time.
Disease: Hydrocele. Category: India-specific | Sub-category: Urology. Explanation: A type of swelling in the scrotum that occurs when fluid collects in the thin sheath surrounding a testicle.

Disease: Hyperglycemia. Also known as: High blood sugar. Category: Global | Sub-category: Endocrinology. Explanation: High blood sugar, which happens when the body has too little insulin or when the body can't use insulin properly.

Disease: Hyperthyroidism. Also known as: Overactive thyroid. Category: Global | Sub-category: Endocrinology. Explanation: A condition in which your thyroid gland produces too much of the hormone thyroxine.. Precautions: massage, eat healthy, take radioactive iodine treatment, use lemon balm

Disease: Hypoglycemia. Also known as: Low blood sugar. Category: Global | Sub-category: Endocrinology. Explanation: Low blood sugar, which can happen if you take too much insulin or don't eat enough.. Symptoms: Shaking, dizziness, confusion, sweating. Treatments: Consuming glucose or sugar-containing foods, adjusting medication or insulin dosage. Precautions: check in pulse, drink sugary drinks, consult doctor, lie down on side

Disease: Hypothyroidism. Also known as: Underactive thyroid. Category: Global | Sub-category: Endocrinology. Explanation: A condition in which your thyroid gland doesn't produce enough of certain crucial hormones.. Symptoms: Fatigue, weight gain, sensitivity to cold, dry skin, constipation, depression, muscle weakness, elevated cholesterol levels. Treatments: Hormone replacement therapy with synthetic thyroid hormone (levothyroxine), regular monitoring of thyroid hormone levels and adjustment of medication dosage, lifestyle modifications (such as healthy diet and regular exercise), management of associated symptoms (such as cholesterol-lowering medications or antidepressants), education and support for long-term management. Precautions: eat healthy, reduce stress, exercise, get proper sleep

Disease: Impetigo. Category: Global | Sub-category: Dermatology. Explanation: A common and highly contagious skin infection that mainly affects infants and children.. Precautions: soak affected area in warm water, consult doctor, use antibiotics, remove scabs with wet compressed cloth

Disease: Infectious Mononucleosis. Also known as: Mono, Glandular fever. Category: Global | Sub-category: Infectious Disease. Explanation: An infectious illness caused by a virus, often called the "kissing disease."
Disease: Influenza. Also known as: Flu. Category: Global | Sub-category: Infectious Disease. Explanation: A viral infection that attacks your respiratory system â€” your nose, throat and lungs.

Disease: Insomnia. Also known as: Sleeplessness. Category: Global | Sub-category: Neurology. Explanation: A common sleep disorder that can make it hard to fall asleep, hard to stay asleep, or cause you to wake up too early and not be able to get back to sleep.

Disease: Interstitial Cystitis. Also known as: Painful bladder syndrome. Category: Global | Sub-category: Urology. Explanation: A chronic condition causing bladder pressure, bladder pain and sometimes pelvic pain.
Disease: Iron Deficiency Anemia. Category: Global | Sub-category: Hematology. Explanation: A common type of anemia â€” a condition in which blood lacks adequate healthy red blood cells.

Disease: Irritable Bowel Syndrome (IBS). Also known as: IBS. Category: Global | Sub-category: Gastroenterology. Explanation: A common disorder that affects the large intestine, causing symptoms like cramping, abdominal pain, bloating, gas, and diarrhea or constipation, or both.
Disease: Japanese Encephalitis. Category: India-specific | Sub-category: Infectious Disease. Explanation: A viral brain infection that's spread through mosquito bites.

Disease: Jaundice. Also known as: Piliya. Category: Global | Sub-category: Gastroenterology. Explanation: A condition in which the skin, whites of the eyes and mucous membranes turn yellow because of a high level of bilirubin, a yellow-orange bile pigment.. Precautions: eat fruits and high fiberous food, consume milk thistle, medication, drink plenty of water

Disease: Kala-azar (Visceral Leishmaniasis). Also known as: Black fever. Category: India-specific | Sub-category: Infectious Disease. Explanation: A parasitic disease found in parts of the tropics, subtropics, and southern Europe, which is transmitted by the bite of infected female phlebotomine sandflies.
Disease: Kawasaki Disease. Category: Global | Sub-category: Pediatrics. Explanation: An illness that causes inflammation in the walls of some blood vessels in the body, primarily in children.
Disease: Kidney Stones. Also known as: Renal calculi. Category: Global | Sub-category: Nephrology. Explanation: Hard deposits made of minerals and salts that form inside your kidneys.
Disease: Kwashiorkor. Category: India-specific | Sub-category: Nutritional Deficiency. Explanation: A form of severe malnutrition characterized by edema and an enlarged liver with fatty infiltrates.

Disease: Kyasanur Forest Disease (KFD). Also known as: Monkey fever. Category: India-specific | Sub-category: Infectious Disease. Explanation: A viral hemorrhagic fever transmitted by ticks, which was first identified in the Kyasanur Forest of Karnataka, India.
Disease: Lactose Intolerance. Category: Global | Sub-category: Gastroenterology. Explanation: The inability to fully digest the sugar (lactose) in dairy products.

Disease: Leprosy. Also known as: Hansen's disease, Kushtha rog. Category: India-specific | Sub-category: Infectious Disease. Explanation: A chronic, progressive bacterial infection that affects the nerves, skin, eyes, and lining of the nose.

Disease: Leptospirosis. Category: India-specific | Sub-category: Infectious Disease. Explanation: A bacterial disease that affects humans and animals, which is spread through the urine of infected animals.

Disease: Leukemia. Also known as: Blood cancer. Category: Global | Sub-category: Oncology. Explanation: A cancer of blood-forming tissues, including bone marrow.. Symptoms: Fatigue, pale skin, frequent infections, easy bleeding or bruising. Treatments: Chemotherapy, radiation therapy, stem cell transplant, targeted therapy, supportive care

Disease: Lice Infestation. Also known as: Pediculosis. Category: Global | Sub-category: Dermatology. Explanation: The infestation with lice, which are tiny, wingless, parasitic insects that feed on your blood.
Disease: Listeriosis. Category: Global | Sub-category: Infectious Disease. Explanation: A serious infection usually caused by eating food contaminated with the bacterium Listeria monocytogenes.

Disease: Lupus. Category: Global | Sub-category: Rheumatology. Explanation: A systemic autoimmune disease that occurs when your body's immune system attacks your own tissues and organs.. Symptoms: Joint pain, fatigue, skin rashes. Treatments: Medications (anti-inflammatory, immunosuppressants), lifestyle modifications
Disease: Lyme Disease. Category: Global | Sub-category: Infectious Disease. Explanation: A bacterial infection you get from the bite of an infected tick.

Disease: Lymphoma. Category: Global | Sub-category: Oncology. Explanation: Cancer of the lymphatic system, which is part of the body's germ-fighting network.. Symptoms: Swollen lymph nodes, unexplained weight loss, fatigue. Treatments: Chemotherapy, radiation therapy, immunotherapy, targeted therapy

Disease: Macular Degeneration. Also known as: Age-related macular degeneration (AMD). Category: Global | Sub-category: Ophthalmology. Explanation: An eye disease that causes vision loss.. Symptoms: Blurred or distorted central vision, blind spots. Treatments: Vision aids, medications (injections into the eye), laser therapy, photodynamic therapy, surgical intervention

Disease: Malaria. Category: India-specific | Sub-category: Infectious Disease. Explanation: A disease caused by a parasite, which is transmitted through the bites of infected female Anopheles mosquitoes.. Precautions: avoid oily food, avoid non veg food, keep mosquitos out, Consult nearest hospital

Disease: Malnutrition. Also known as: Kuposhan. Category: Global | Sub-category: Nutritional Deficiency. Explanation: Lack of proper nutrition, caused by not having enough to eat, not eating enough of the right things, or being unable to use the food that one does eat.
Disease: Marasmus. Category: India-specific | Sub-category: Nutritional Deficiency. Explanation: A form of severe malnutrition characterized by energy deficiency.

Disease: Measles. Also known as: Khasra. Category: Global | Sub-category: Infectious Disease. Explanation: A childhood infection caused by a virus, which is now almost always preventable with a vaccine.

Disease: Melanoma. Also known as: Skin cancer. Category: Global | Sub-category: Oncology. Explanation: The most serious type of skin cancer, which develops in the cells (melanocytes) that produce melanin â€” the pigment that gives your skin its color.
Disease: Meningitis. Category: Global | Sub-category: Neurology. Explanation: Inflammation of the fluid and membranes (meninges) surrounding your brain and spinal cord.
Disease: Menopause. Category: Global | Sub-category: Gynecology. Explanation: The time that marks the end of your menstrual cycles.

Disease: Mental Illness. Also known as: Mental health disorder. Category: Global | Sub-category: Psychiatry. Explanation: Health conditions involving changes in emotion, thinking or behavior (or a combination of these).
Disease: Middle Ear Infection. Also known as: Otitis media. Category: Global | Sub-category: Otolaryngology. Explanation: An infection of the air-filled space behind the eardrum.

Disease: Migraine. Category: Global | Sub-category: Neurology. Explanation: A headache that can cause severe throbbing pain or a pulsing sensation, usually on one side of the head.. Symptoms: Severe headaches, nausea, sensitivity to light and sound. Treatments: Pain-relieving medications, lifestyle changes, preventive medications. Precautions: meditation, reduce stress, consult doctor, use poloroid glasses in sun
Disease: Miscarriage. Category: Global | Sub-category: Gynecology. Explanation: The spontaneous loss of a pregnancy before the 20th week.

Disease: MRSA (Methicillin-resistant Staphylococcus aureus). Category: Global | Sub-category: Infectious Disease. Explanation: A cause of staph infection that is difficult to treat because of resistance to some antibiotics.
Disease: Multiple Sclerosis (MS). Also known as: MS. Category: Global | Sub-category: Neurology. Explanation: A potentially disabling disease of the brain and spinal cord (central nervous system).

Disease: Mumps. Category: Global | Sub-category: Infectious Disease. Explanation: A viral infection that primarily affects saliva-producing (salivary) glands that are located near your ears.. Symptoms: Swollen salivary glands (usually parotid), fever, headache, fatigue. Treatments: Supportive care, pain relievers, isolation, vaccination (MMR)

Disease: Muscular Dystrophy. Category: Global | Sub-category: Neurology. Explanation: A group of genetic diseases that cause progressive weakness and loss of muscle mass.. Symptoms: Progressive muscle weakness and degeneration, difficulty walking or moving, muscle wasting. Treatments: Supportive care, physical therapy, assistive devices, medications for symptom management, gene therapies (in some cases)

Disease: Myasthenia Gravis. Category: Global | Sub-category: Neurology. Explanation: A chronic autoimmune, neuromuscular disease that causes weakness in the skeletal muscles.. Symptoms: Muscle weakness, fatigue, difficulty speaking. Treatments: Medications (acetylcholinesterase inhibitors, immunosuppressants), thymectomy (in some cases)

Disease: Narcolepsy. Category: Global | Sub-category: Neurology. Explanation: A chronic sleep disorder characterized by overwhelming daytime sleepiness and sudden attacks of sleep.. Symptoms: Excessive daytime sleepiness, sudden loss of muscle tone (cataplexy). Treatments: Stimulant medications, antidepressants, lifestyle modifications, scheduled naps

Disease: Nipah Virus Infection. Category: India-specific | Sub-category: Infectious Disease. Explanation: A viral infection that can be transmitted from animals to humans, which can also be transmitted through contaminated food or directly between people.
Disease: Norovirus Infection. Also known as: Stomach bug. Category: Global | Sub-category: Infectious Disease. Explanation: A very contagious virus that causes vomiting and diarrhea.

Disease: Oral Cancer. Also known as: Mouth cancer. Category: India-specific | Sub-category: Oncology. Explanation: Cancer that develops in any of the parts that make up the mouth (oral cavity).

Disease: Osteoarthritis. Also known as: Degenerative joint disease. Category: Global | Sub-category: Rheumatology. Disease: Osteoporosis. Category: Global | Sub-category: Endocrinology. Explanation: A condition in which bones become weak and brittle.. Symptoms: Fragile bones, loss of height over time, back pain, fractures. Treatments: Calcium and vitamin D supplements, regular exercise, medications to slow bone loss
Disease: Ovarian Cancer. Category: Global | Sub-category: Oncology. Explanation: A cancer that begins in the ovaries.
Disease: Pancreatic Cancer. Category: Global | Sub-category: Oncology. Explanation: Cancer that begins in the organ lying behind the lower part of the stomach (pancreas).

Disease: Panic Disorder. Category: Global | Sub-category: Psychiatry. Explanation: A psychiatric disorder in which debilitating anxiety and fear arise frequently and without reasonable cause.. Disease: Parkinson's Disease. Category: Global | Sub-category: Neurology. Explanation: A progressive nervous system disorder that affects movement.
Disease: Pelvic Inflammatory Disease (PID). Also known as: PID. Category: Global | Sub-category: Gynecology. Explanation: An infection of the female reproductive organs.

Disease: Peripheral Artery Disease (PAD). Also known as: PAD. Category: Global | Sub-category: Cardiology. Explanation: A common circulatory problem in which narrowed arteries reduce blood flow to your limbs.

Disease: Pertussis. Also known as: Whooping cough, Kali khansi. Category: Global | Sub-category: Infectious Disease. Explanation: A highly contagious respiratory tract infection that is easily preventable by vaccine.

Disease: Polio (Poliomyelitis). Also known as: Polio. Category: Global | Sub-category: Infectious Disease. Explanation: A contagious viral illness that in its most severe form causes nerve injury leading to paralysis, difficulty breathing and sometimes death.
Disease: Polycystic Ovary Syndrome (PCOS). Also known as: PCOS. Category: Global | Sub-category: Gynecology. Explanation: A hormonal disorder common among women of reproductive age.

Disease: Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD). Also known as: PTSD. Category: Global | Sub-category: Psychiatry. Explanation: A mental health condition that's triggered by a terrifying event â€” either experiencing it or witnessing it.

Disease: Preeclampsia. Category: Global | Sub-category: Obstetrics. Explanation: A pregnancy complication characterized by high blood pressure and signs of damage to another organ system, most often the liver and kidneys.. Symptoms: High blood pressure, proteinuria, swelling, headaches, visual disturbances. Treatments: Bed rest, blood pressure monitoring, frequent prenatal visits, medication (such as antihypertensive drugs), magnesium sulfate (for severe cases), delivery of the baby (in severe cases)

Disease: Prostate Cancer. Category: Global | Sub-category: Oncology. Explanation: Cancer that occurs in the prostate â€” a small walnut-shaped gland in males that produces the seminal fluid that nourishes and transports sperm.

Disease: Psoriasis. Category: Global | Sub-category: Dermatology. Explanation: A skin disease that causes red, itchy scaly patches, most commonly on the knees, elbows, trunk and scalp.. Disease: Pulmonary Embolism. Category: Global | Sub-category: Pulmonology. Explanation: A blockage in one of the pulmonary arteries in your lungs, which is usually caused by blood clots that travel to the lungs from deep veins in the legs.

Disease: Restless Legs Syndrome (RLS). Category: Global | Sub-category: Neurology. Explanation: A condition that causes an uncontrollable urge to move your legs, usually because of an uncomfortable sensation.

Disease: Schizophrenia. Category: Global | Sub-category: Psychiatry. Explanation: A serious mental disorder in which people interpret reality abnormally.
Disease: Scoliosis. Category: Global | Sub-category: Orthopedics. Explanation: A sideways curvature of the spine.

Disease: Smallpox. Category: Global | Sub-category: Infectious Disease. Explanation: An eradicated virus that used to be contagious, disfiguring, and often deadly.
Disease: Strep Throat. Category: Global | Sub-category: Infectious Disease. Explanation: A bacterial infection that can make your throat feel sore and scratchy.

Disease: Stroke. Also known as: Brain attack. Category: Global | Sub-category: Neurology. Explanation: A medical emergency that occurs when the blood supply to part of your brain is interrupted or reduced, preventing brain tissue from getting oxygen and nutrients.. Symptoms: Sudden numbness or weakness of the face, arm, or leg (typically on one side of the body), confusion, trouble speaking or understanding, severe headache. Treatments: Emergency medical attention, medication (clot-busting drugs, anticoagulants), supportive care, rehabilitation (physical therapy, speech therapy), lifestyle modifications (diet, exercise, smoking cessation), addressing underlying risk factors

Disease: Tay-Sachs Disease. Category: Global | Sub-category: Genetics. Explanation: A rare, inherited disorder that destroys nerve cells in the brain and spinal cord.

Disease: Vasculitis. Category: Global | Sub-category: Rheumatology. Explanation: Inflammation of the blood vessels.. It may include corticosteroids, immunosuppressive medications (such as cyclophosphamide or azathioprine), biologic therapies (such as rituximab), disease-specific treatments (such as plasmapheresis for certain types), supportive care to manage symptoms (such as pain relievers or blood pressure medications), monitoring and management of associated complications (such as organ damage or infections)
